title: How to gift a Kindle e-book which I already own - Quora

response.answer_text: You can’t. You do not have the right to give away intellectual property you don’t own. You don’t own the digital book, you bought the right to read the book and have it in ONE library, yours. If you talk to Amazon you might have the book removed from your library permanently (which Amazon always has online if you get a new device), and then give it to someone but I doubt they will like that or even find it legal. For gifting a book that you buy again there is another link on the right side of the browser window which says “Give as gift”.

How can I gift a Kindle e-book which I already own? You can’t do it directly, as you could with a physical book. But if you don’t want to pay for a second Kindle license, be aware that Amazon will sometimes give refunds for Kindle books — I don’t know what the requirements are — and if they will refund you, you can then click on the “Buy for others” button and use that money to re-buy the e-book for your friend.

I just checked, and Timothy Ellis' answer is correct. You can give another copy of a Kindle book you already own, but for that you don’t use “Buy now…” but “Give as a gift” button. That said, Amazon has filed a number of patents for a mechanism that yould allow owners of e-book licenses to resell (or gift) them. Publishers were not interested, as expected.

You cannot give away a book from your Kindle library, though you can delete it permanently if you like. What you CAN do in some cases is LOAN the book. If you can, it will show “you purchased this book on July 4, 2016. Loan this book to…”. This is an option chosen by the publisher. Or not chosen. If you do lend the book you don't have to ask for it back. It expires automatically. You or your friend can also look for the book in your local public library, online, and borrow it from their site. Many libraries in the US support the Overdrive app.

I looked at the product screen of a book I already purchased. Yes, it said I bought this book on such and such date, but it also had the One Click button to buy again and the Give as a Gift button are all active. I can also loan some of the books to others. Maybe take another look at the page.

Short answer is you can't. You can however give Kindle ebooks as gifts if you buy them specifically as such, so the receiver of the gift will get them encrypted for his own user and reading device/app. If you bought it for yourself then nobody but you can decrypt/read the eBook.
You’re probably clicking the wrong button. To gift to someone else you use the red ringed button in this example. It’s not always available, but should be on most eBooks.
